attributes.comment:
Regarding: DHS Docket No. USCIS-2006-0044
Please do not increase the fees associated with international adoption. Federal
Register 8 CFR Part 103 proposes that filing fee for the I-600/I-600A will increase
from $545 to $670.

International adoption itself is a time-consuming, emotional and expensive
process for the adopting parents. For example, we are adopting from China and
our estimated total adoption cost is over $24,000. People adopting are not rich
and this is a huge sum of money, but folks simply want to build their family and,
for a variety of different reasons, international adoption is their best option for doing
so.

In the Federal Register announcement, Table 6 outlines the projected workload
volume for I-600/I-600A. One reason for the increase in workload volume is
because adoption processing timeframes in China have increased and families are
having to file TWO I-600A to complete their adoption. For example, we filed our I-
600A in November 2005 and our paperwork was sent to China at the end of
December 2005. Our adoption has still not completed and we had to re-file our I-
600A this month because our I-171H was going to expire (June 2007) before the
adoption was completed.

The fact that we have already been approved to adopt by USCIS but then have to
re-file and be re-approved because our I-171H expires in June 2007 but we won?t
be bringing home our child until at least October 2007 added over $900 to our
adoption costs. Was it really necessary for us to be re-approved and pay all the
fees again to simply get us through four to five more months until we completed
the adopting process? This increases the workload volume at USCIS.

Instead of increasing the fee for filing the I-600/I-600A because of projected
workload volume increase, simply extend the validity timeframe of the I-171H from
18 months to 24 months and leave the fees unchanged. This will relieve some of
the financial burden of Americans adopting internationally and it will mean that
there won?t be an increase in I-600/I-600A filings because families waiting for their
referral won?t have to re-file.

Thank you for your consideration.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Shannon Gaub
